title: Gen Z's battle with social media addiction
description: Facebook has come under fire for the impact its apps can have on teens and their mental health.

title: Climate change: Tracking China's steel addiction in one city
description: The BBC travels to Wuzhou to see how cities are grappling with climate targets and a "build" mantra.

title: How tech could help spot disasters before they happen
description: How technology could help the insurance industry spot potential disasters before they occur.

title: Murray 'back in good books' over 'stolen' wedding ring
description: Andy Murray says he is "back in the good books" after his "stolen" tennis shoes and wedding ring were found in Indian Wells.

title: Ants feeding off honeydew wins the Royal Society of Biology's photo prize
description: A picture taken by Vishwanath Birje captures the mutualistic relationship between the ants and the aphid

title: Fast fashion: The dumping ground for unwanted clothes
description: Countries in West Africa are said to be drowning under the weight of waste shipped to their shores.

title: Newcastle takeover a special day for fans - Shearer
description: Alan Shearer says the Saudi Arabian-backed takeover of Newcastle is a "special day" for the club's long-suffering supporters.

title: Malaria vaccine: When will it be available?
description: Following the announcement about the first malaria vaccine, we look at some of the key questions.

title: Firms warn of price rises as energy bills soar
description: High energy costs could put up goods prices, say firms, with households already facing bigger gas bills.

title: Nobel Literature Prize 2021: Abdulrazak Gurnah named winner
description: The Swedish Academy praised him for his writings on the effects of colonialism.

title: Find more money for universal credit, says senior Tory Steve Baker
description: Ex-minister Steve Baker adds his voice to calls for a U-turn, amid concerns over living standards.

title: NatWest faces fine over money laundering failings
description: The state-backed bank pleads guilty to offences and could now be hit with a large penalty.

title: Greenpeace loses North Sea Vorlich field legal challenge
description: The environmental group had argued permission should not have been granted by the UK government for the Vorlich oil field.

title: Nazi trial: 100-year-old SS guard in court in Germany
description: Josef S is accused of complicity in the murder of 3,518 prisoners at Sachsenhausen near Berlin.

title: Business is not the bogeyman, firms tell Boris Johnson
description: Supermarket chain Iceland says blaming business for supply shortages is "simply not helpful".

title: Tyson Fury v Deontay Wilder III: Malik Scott backing American to regain world heavyweight title
description: Deontay Wilder's trainer Malik Scott says Tyson Fury has never seen "this" Wilder before, and his man will not lose when the pair meet on Saturday night in Las Vegas.

title: Brexit: New NI Protocol proposals to be brought by EU
description: The proposals will be "very far reaching", says European Commission Vice President Maros Šefčovič.

title: Premier League urged to alter owners' test as Saudi Arabian-backed takeover of Newcastle nears
description: Amnesty International has urged the Premier League to change its owners' and directors' test "to address human rights issues" amid the Saudi Arabian-backed takeover of Newcastle United.

title: The old foe aiming to help Wilder win against Fury
description: From being knocked out by him in 2014, Malik Scott is now helping Deontay Wilder try to regain his WBC world heavyweight title.

title: Boris Johnson's conference speech fact-checked
description: Claims about growth, hospitals, life expectancy and wages checked.

title: Stokes likely to miss Ashes after second operation on finger
description: England all-rounder Ben Stokes has a second operation on his injured finger and is unlikely to play in the Ashes against Australia this winter.

title: Prince Andrew to receive Epstein-Giuffre agreement
description: His legal team believes the sealed document will end a case brought by his accuser, Virginia Giuffre.

title: 'I think other people looked at me as a trailblazer'
description: As part of Black History Month, Rosie Sykes, the first black woman to play for hockey for England, and England U21s player Darcy Bourne, talk about trailblazing in hockey.

title: Islamic State mother Nicole Jack says 'don't sweep us under carpet'
description: Nicole Jack, who joined IS in 2015, says she is "out of sight, out of mind" in a camp in Syria.

title: The Papers: Business backlash for PM and 'build back banter'
description: Reaction to Boris Johnson's Tory Party conference speech dominates the newspaper front pages.

title: James Bond star Daniel Craig gets Hollywood Walk of Fame star
description: The outgoing James Bond actor says it is "an absolute honour to be walked all over in Hollywood".
